Package ca.cgjennings.spelling.dict

Class BucketList

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.spelling.dict.AbstractWordList
ca.cgjennings.spelling.dict.BucketList
All Implemented Interfaces:
WordList
public class BucketList extends AbstractWordList
A bucket list is a word list intended for small dictionaries like the user's list of learned words. Bucket lists have the advantage that they are stored as small, human-readable plain text files. However, computing a list of suggestions for a bucket list is slow when the number of words in the list is large, and bucket lists do not support frequency ranking data.

Compared to a ternary tree file, the plain text files written by a bucket list are usually a little smaller (much smaller if compressed). Plain text files can be written quickly but are slower to read in. Ternary tree files take longer to write but can be read in very quickly.

Note: When writing a bucket list to a file, an optimization level of 0 will produce a plain text word list (using the UTF-8 character encoding). Higher optimization levels will produce a CPL (common prefix length) compressed plain text file. When reading a file, it is assumed that it could be CPL compressed. In most cases, an uncompressed list can be read back as a CPL list without any problems; the exception is plain text files containing words that start with a digit or asterisk. If this could be an issue, use the more specific read methods. Both uncompressed and compressed files may include comment lines that start with #. (Compressed files may also include words that start with a #, but in an uncompressed file these would appear as comments.)

      public Set<String> findWordsWithinEditDistance​(String word, int d)
      Description copied from class: AbstractWordList
      Returns a set of the words within edit distance d of word. A Hamming distance of d means that up to d letters in a matching word can be different, inserted, or deleted in word.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      d - the acceptable edit distance
      Returns:

      protected void readImpl​(InputStream in) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: AbstractWordList
      Reads the list from a stream.

      This is called by the default implementations of the public read methods to perform the actual read operations. Subclasses need only implement this method to provide reading capabilities.

    • read

      public void read​(File f, int optLevel) throws IOException
      Reads a word list using a method that is always compatible with a given optimization level; if optLevel is 0, the list is assumed to be uncompressed. Otherwise it is assumed to be compressed.
      Parameters:
      f - the file to read words from
      optLevel - the optimization level that was used to write the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      public void read​(BufferedReader list, boolean commaSeparated, boolean ignoreComments) throws IOException
      Reads this list from a BufferedReader containing a list of words. Each non-empty line in this stream will be treated as a word to be added to the dictionary. If commaSeparated is true, then each line is treated as a sublist of words to be added where each word is separated by a comma and/or white space. If ignoreComments is true, lines starting with '#' will be ignored as comments.
      Parameters:
      list - the stream from which to fetch words
      ignoreComments - ignore comment lines
      commaSeparated - if true, treat lines as a out of words
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
